title: Did anyone tell Trump that COVID-19 was likely to be a major problem for people in the United States, or did he come to that conclusion entirely on his own? - Quora
tags: Politics of the United States of America

response.answer_text: Did anyone tell Trump that COVID-19 was likely to be a major problem for people in the United States, or did he come to that conclusion entirely on his own? There are several opportunities to get a jump on this epidemic. DOD made note of something going on in Wuhan in November of last year. There were articles in science journals in the beginning of December about a new contagion causing server pneumonia in the Wuhan region of China. Dr. Rick Bright sent out a warning in January about the encroaching pandemic and urged those in HHS to ramp up on supplies, such as masks and gowns. His boss, Alex Azar, refused to take these warnings to Trump and to finally shut Dr. Bright up he essentially removed him from his position. Now some will say the Trump acted decisively by closing down travel from China the a few weeks later from some European Countries. But the Virus has already been in the country since December. After reviewing medical records it has now been determined that the first death due to Covid19 was in January in Santa Clara County. Italy has determined that their first death occurred in December. Florida has determined that there were cases in that state in December. We have an administration that has the idea that they know more about anything than anyone else. The president sports an invisible sign on his back that says, “Kiss my ass -or else!” As the knowledgeable people get winnow out because they spoke truth to power and replaced by the most unqualified toadies to fill those positions. Like Alex Azar who was a lobbyist for the pharmaceutical industry who hired a dog breeder from Texas to manage Covid19 response team a HHS These are the backgrounds that have our safety under their leadership. Trump did not come to any conclusion on his own and only acted when it became apparent that it will have a negative impact on his re-election efforts. He had daily briefings, which were not about the pandemic but him. He has also spent the last month trying to hang blame on everyone and everything else because he, of course, is blameless and takes no responsibility for the current dismal situation we are now in. But the sad matter he is totally responsible for ruining the FDA, HHS, USDA and the pandemic task force put in place by the previous administration. He also could not see the need to renew the service contracts to maintain the US inventory of medical equipment like ventilators. I cringe every time he put members of his family in charge of anything. Kushner’s heading up the pandemic response team has to be the most laughable failure of Trumps response. When this level of incompetence runs the country when an emergency we see what happen 72,000 people dead in two months and there is no end in sight.

i don’t think he’s come to that conclusion yet. in january he poohpoohed the whole thing, said that people were exaggerating it to attack him. all february he insisted it was nothing important. in march, somebody shoved a chart in his face of the numbers, and he realized his re-election was in danger if that happened, so he began to make mouth sounds about it, but he still has done very little substantive. he missed the boat. if he had acted early and forcefully to stem th assault of the virus, his re-election would be a no brainer. he would be the hero he wants to be now. but he’s an expert at misreading situations and he has no courage.

When the World Health Organization finally admitted that COVID-19 was contagious, every world leader had to know that it was a major problem. It just happens that President Trump was the 2nd leader to take action.

We have documentation that: Azar informed Trump of the graveness of covid-19 on Jan 18Navarro provided e memo which apparently displeased Trump on Jan 29WHO declared a public health emergency on Jan 30It is not clear how much more notice Trump could have received. Given that Trump: refused Azar’s request for funding for emergency supplies for covid-19 on Feb 5compared covid-19 to the flu and said we would have near zero cases on or about Feb 24we can say that Trump did not accept the warnings.

Fauci stated that Trump listens to everything he has to say….“He goes his own way. He has his own style,” Fauci, the longtime director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, said in the telephone interview with the magazine on Sunday. “But on substantive issues, he does listen to what I say.” But it does seem then that Trump hears what he wants to hear. And you can’t tell him anything he doesn’t want to know. And facts and truth to Trump are only to be used when they support his goals… and fantasies.

Given that he was the first Western leader to appreciate the gravity of the coronavirus situation, hence he imposed restrictions on travel from China and declared the situation a medical emergency by 02/02/2020 and was castigated for racism and alarmism by the ‘usual suspects’ - at which point the China-apologist WTO was still claiming the virus was not transmissible by contact, it seems likely he made his mind up for himself. And, as usual, he was entirely correct.
The only conclusion he came to by himself is , it isn’t good for him. He didn’t care enough to worry about anyone else.
He hasn’t the mental capacity nor acuity to come to a decision. That implies thinking. Planing. Considering alternatives. He reacts, like a wolf sighting prey.
Sure someone must have told him. He is not the sharpest tack!
